page.title: 14THE OLD SUN INN
page.content: The Old Sun is one of only two pubs in Heyford - at one time there were 9! The Old Sun, in Middle St., is built on the site of a Monk's Hospice; a hospice was a place where, in the Middle Ages, travellers could rest - an early hotel. It is said that when the hospice was pulled down the stone was taken to build the old Manor House on the road to Upper Heyford. When this Manor House was knocked down the stone was brought back and used in the building of the Old Sun over 200 years ago. The pub has just had a new building added on, toilets and a new bar, but it has been built in the same style as the old buildings and so it merges in well. One of the Old Sun's regular customers is Albert Garrett, he is 86 years old and he lives next to the pub, in the house that was built in 1861 for the schoolmaster of that time.
